sections.summary: Operating Standards: frequency privileges; emission standards; automatic message forwarding; frequency sharing; stations aboard ships or aircraft

questions.text: When using a transceiver that displays the carrier frequency of phone signals, which of the following displayed frequencies represents the highest frequency at which a properly adjusted USB emission will be totally within the band?

answers.D: 3 kHz below the upper band edge
answers.B: 300 Hz below the upper band edge
answers.C: 1 kHz below the upper band edge

questions.text: When using a transceiver that displays the carrier frequency of phone signals, which of the following displayed frequencies represents the lowest frequency at which a properly adjusted LSB emission will be totally within the band?

answers.D: 3 kHz above the lower band edge
answers.B: 300 Hz above the lower band edge
answers.C: 1 kHz above the lower band edge

questions.text: With your transceiver displaying the carrier frequency of phone signals, you hear a DX station's CQ on 14.349 MHz USB. Is it legal to return the call using upper sideband on the same frequency?

answers.D: No, USA stations are not permitted to use phone emissions above 14.340 MHz
answers.B: Yes, because the displayed frequency is within the 20 meter band
answers.C: No, my sidebands will extend beyond the band edge
answers.A: Yes, because the DX station initiated the contact

questions.text: With your transceiver displaying the carrier frequency of phone signals, you hear a DX station calling CQ on 3.601 MHz LSB. Is it legal to return the call using lower sideband on the same frequency?

answers.D: No, USA stations are not permitted to use phone emissions below 3.610 MHz
answers.B: Yes, because the displayed frequency is within the 75 meter phone band segment
answers.C: No, my sidebands will extend beyond the edge of the phone band segment
answers.A: Yes, because the DX station initiated the contact

questions.text: What is the maximum power output permitted on the 60 meter band?

answers.D: 100 watts PEP effective radiated power relative to an isotropic radiator
answers.B: 50 watts PEP effective radiated power relative to a dipole
answers.C: 100 watts PEP effective radiated power relative to the gain of a half-wave dipole
answers.A: 50 watts PEP effective radiated power relative to an isotropic radiator

answers.D: All of these choices are correct
answers.B: Operation is restricted to specific emission types and specific channels
answers.C: Operation is restricted to LSB

questions.text: Which of the following describes the rules for operation on the 60 meter band?
What is the only amateur band where transmission on specific channels rather than a range of frequencies is permitted?

answers.D: 60 meter band
answers.C: 30 meter band

questions.text: If a station in a message forwarding system inadvertently forwards a message that is in violation of FCC rules, who is primarily accountable for the rules violation?

answers.D: The control operators of all the stations in the system not authenticating the source from which they accept communications
answers.B: The control operator of the originating station
answers.C: The control operators of all the stations in the system
answers.A: The control operator of the packet bulletin board station

questions.text: What is the first action you should take if your digital message forwarding station inadvertently forwards a communication that violates FCC rules?

answers.D: Discontinue forwarding all messages
answers.B: Notify the originating station that the communication does not comply with FCC rules
answers.C: Notify the nearest FCC Field Engineer's office
answers.A: Discontinue forwarding the communication as soon as you become aware of it

questions.text: If an amateur station is installed aboard a ship or aircraft, what condition must be met before the station is operated?

answers.D: Its operator must have an FCC Marine or Aircraft endorsement on his or her amateur license
answers.B: The amateur station operator must agree to not transmit when the main ship or aircraft radios are in use
answers.C: It must have a power supply that is completely independent of the main ship or aircraft power supply
answers.A: Its operation must be approved by the master of the ship or the pilot in command of the aircraft

answers.D: An unrestricted Radiotelephone Operator Permit
answers.B: Any FCC-issued amateur license or a reciprocal permit for an alien amateur licensee
answers.C: Only General class or higher amateur licenses
answers.A: Any amateur license with an FCC Marine or Aircraft endorsement

questions.text: What authorization or licensing is required when operating an amateur station aboard a US-registered vessel in international waters?

answers.D: No, USA stations are not permitted to use CW emissions below 3.525 MHz
answers.B: Yes, the displayed frequency is within the 80 meter CW band segment
answers.C: No, sidebands from the CW signal will be out of the band.
answers.A: Yes, the DX station initiated the contact

questions.text: With your transceiver displaying the carrier frequency of CW signals, you hear a DX station's CQ on 3.500 MHz. Is it legal to return the call using CW on the same frequency?

answers.D: Any person named in an amateur station license grant or a person holding an unrestricted Radiotelephone Operator Permit
answers.B: Any person holding an FCC-issued amateur license or who is authorized for alien reciprocal operation
answers.C: Only a person named in an amateur station license grant
answers.A: Only a person with an FCC Marine Radio

questions.text: Who must be in physical control of the station apparatus of an amateur station aboard any vessel or craft that is documented or registered in the United States?

sections.summary: Station restrictions and special operations: restrictions on station location; general operating restrictions; spurious emissions, control operator reimbursement; antenna structure restrictions; RACES operations

questions.text: Which of the following constitutes a spurious emission?

answers.D: An emission outside its necessary bandwidth that can be reduced or eliminated without affecting the information transmitted
answers.B: A signal transmitted to prevent its detection by any station other than the intended recipient
answers.C: Any transmitted bogus signal that interferes with another licensed radio station
answers.A: An amateur station transmission made at random without the proper call sign identification

questions.text: Which of the following factors might cause the physical location of an amateur station apparatus or antenna structure to be restricted?

answers.D: The location is of environmental importance or significant in American history, architecture, or culture
answers.B: The location is of geographical or horticultural importance
answers.C: The location is in an ITU zone designated for coordination with one or more foreign governments
answers.A: The location is near an area of political conflict

questions.text: Within what distance must an amateur station protect an FCC monitoring facility from harmful interference?

answers.D: 30 miles
answers.C: 10 miles

questions.text: What must be done before placing an amateur station within an officially designated wilderness area or wildlife preserve, or an area listed in the National Register of Historical Places?

answers.D: A form FSD-15 must be submitted to the Department of the Interior
answers.B: A letter of intent must be filed with the National Audubon Society
answers.C: An Environmental Assessment must be submitted to the FCC
answers.A: A proposal must be submitted to the National Park Service

answers.D: 2.8 kHz
answers.C: 1.5 kHz

questions.text: What is the maximum bandwidth for a data emission on 60 meters?
Which of the following additional rules apply if you are installing an amateur station antenna at a site at or near a public use airport?

answers.D: You must obtain a construction permit from the airport zoning authority
answers.B: No special rules apply if your antenna structure will be less than 300 feet in height
answers.C: You must file an Environmental Impact Statement with the EPA before construction begins
answers.A: You may have to notify the Federal Aviation Administration and register it with the FCC as required by Part 17 of FCC rules

answers.D: On any frequency where the signal's sidebands are within the channel
answers.B: At the center frequency of the channel
answers.C: At the highest frequency of the channel
answers.A: At the lowest frequency of the channel

questions.text: Where must the carrier frequency of a CW signal be set to comply with FCC rules for 60 meter operation?

answers.D: The amateur station must avoid transmitting during certain hours on frequencies that cause the interference
answers.B: The amateur station must cease operation on all frequencies below 30 MHz
answers.C: The amateur station must cease operation on all frequencies above 30 MHz
answers.A: The amateur station must cease operation

questions.text: What limitations may the FCC place on an amateur station if its signal causes interference to domestic broadcast reception, assuming that the receiver(s) involved are of good engineering design?
Which amateur stations may be operated in RACES?

answers.D: Any FCC-licensed amateur station participating in the Military Affiliate Radio System (MARS)
answers.B: Any FCC-licensed amateur station except a Technician class operator's station
answers.C: Any FCC-licensed amateur station certified by the responsible civil defense organization for the area served
answers.A: Only those club stations licensed to Amateur Extra class operators

questions.text: What frequencies are authorized to an amateur station participating in RACES?

answers.D: Military Affiliate Radio System (MARS) channels
answers.B: Specific segments in the amateur service MF, HF, VHF and UHF bands
answers.C: Specific local government channels
answers.A: All amateur service frequencies authorized to the control operator

answers.D: At least 73 dB below
answers.C: At least 63 dB below

questions.text: What is the permitted mean power of any spurious emission relative to the mean power of the fundamental emission from a station transmitter or external RF amplifier installed after January 1, 2003, and transmitting on a frequency below 30 MHZ?
What is the highest modulation index permitted at the highest modulation frequency for angle modulation?

sections.summary: Station Control: Definitions and restrictions pertaining to local, automatic and remote control operation; control operator responsibilities for remote and automatically controlled stations

questions.text: What is a remotely controlled station?

answers.D: A station controlled indirectly through a control link
answers.B: A station controlled by someone other than the licensee
answers.C: A station operating under automatic control
answers.A: A station operated away from its regular home location

questions.text: What is meant by automatic control of a station?

answers.D: The use of a control link between a control point and a locally controlled station
answers.B: A station operating with its output power controlled automatically
answers.C: Remotely controlling a station's antenna pattern through a directional control link
answers.A: The use of devices and procedures for control so that the control operator does not have to be present at a control point

questions.text: How do the control operator responsibilities of a station under automatic control differ from one under local control?

answers.D: Under local control a control operator is not required to be present at a control point
answers.B: Under automatic control the control operator is not required to be present at the control point
answers.C: Under automatic control there is no control operator
answers.A: Under local control there is no control operator

answers.D: When approved by the National Telecommunication and Information Administration
answers.B: Only when transmitting RTTY or data emissions
answers.C: When specifically agreed upon by the sending and receiving stations

questions.text: When may an automatically controlled station retransmit third party communications?

answers.D: When approved by the National Telecommunication and Information Administration
answers.B: Only when transmitting an RTTY or data emissions
answers.C: When specifically agreed upon by the sending and receiving stations

questions.text: When may an automatically controlled station originate third party communications?
Which of the following statements concerning remotely controlled amateur stations is true?

answers.D: Repeater and auxiliary stations may not be remotely controlled
answers.B: A control operator need not be present at the control point
answers.C: A control operator must be present at the control point
answers.A: Only Extra Class operators may be the control operator of a remote station

questions.text: What is meant by local control?

answers.D: Controlling a repeater using a portable handheld transceiver
answers.C: Direct manipulation of the transmitter by a control operator
answers.A: Controlling a station through a local auxiliary link

questions.text: What is the maximum permissible duration of a remotely controlled station's transmissions if its control link malfunctions?

answers.D: 10 minutes
answers.C: 5 minutes

questions.text: Which of these frequencies are available for an automatically controlled repeater operating below 30 MHz?
What types of amateur stations may automatically retransmit the radio signals of other amateur stations?

answers.D: Only auxiliary, beacon or space stations
answers.B: Only auxiliary, repeater or space stations
answers.C: Only earth stations, repeater stations or model craft
answers.A: Only beacon, repeater or space stations

sections.summary: Amateur Satellite service: definitions and purpose; license requirements for space stations; available frequencies and bands; telecommand and telemetry operations; restrictions and special provisions; notification requirements

questions.text: What is the definition of the term telemetry?

answers.D: One-way transmission that initiates, modifies, or terminates the functions of a device at a distance
answers.C: Two-way single channel transmissions of data
answers.B: Two-way radiotelephone transmissions in excess of 1000 feet
answers.A: One-way transmission of measurements at a distance from the measuring instrument

questions.text: What is the amateur satellite service?

answers.D: A radio communications service using stations on Earth satellites for public service broadcast
answers.C: A radio communications service using amateur radio stations on satellites
answers.B: A spacecraft launching service for amateur-built satellites
answers.A: A radio navigation service using satellites for the purpose of self training, intercommunication and technical studies carried out by amateurs

questions.text: What is a telecommand station in the amateur satellite service?

answers.D: An amateur station that transmits telemetry consisting of measurements of upper atmosphere data from space
answers.C: An amateur station located more than 50 km above the Earth's surface
answers.B: An amateur station that transmits communications to initiate, modify or terminate functions of a space station
answers.A: An amateur station located on the Earth's surface for communications with other Earth stations by means of Earth satellites

questions.text: What is an Earth station in the amateur satellite service?

answers.D: Any amateur station on the surface of the Earth
answers.C: An amateur station that transmits telemetry consisting of measurement of upper atmosphere data from space
answers.B: An amateur station that is not able to communicate using amateur satellites
answers.A: An amateur station within 50 km of the Earth's surface intended for communications with amateur stations by means of objects in space

questions.text: What class of licensee is authorized to be the control operator of a space station?

answers.D: Only Amateur Extra Class
answers.C: All classes
answers.B: Only General, Advanced or Amateur Extra Class

questions.text: Which of the following special provisions must a space station incorporate in order to comply with space station requirements?

answers.D: All of these choices are correct
answers.C: The space station must be capable of changing its orbit whenever such a change is ordered by NASA
answers.B: The space station must cease all transmissions after 5 years
answers.A: The space station must be capable of terminating transmissions by telecommand when directed by the FCC

questions.text: Which amateur service HF bands have frequencies authorized to space stations?

answers.D: All HF bands
answers.C: 40m, 30m, 20m, 15m, 12m and 10m bands

questions.text: Which VHF amateur service bands have frequencies available for space stations?

answers.D: 2 meters
answers.C: 2 meters and 1.25 meters

questions.text: Which amateur stations are eligible to be telecommand stations?

answers.D: All of these choices are correct
answers.C: Any amateur station so designated by the ITU
answers.B: Any amateur station so designated by the space station licensee, subject to the privileges of the class of operator license held by the control operator
answers.A: Any amateur station designated by NASA

questions.text: Which amateur stations are eligible to operate as Earth stations?

answers.D: Any amateur station, subject to the privileges of the class of operator license held by the control operator
answers.C: Only those of Amateur Extra Class operators
answers.B: Only those of General, Advanced or Amateur Extra Class operators
answers.A: Any amateur station whose licensee has filed a pre-space notification with the FCC's International Bureau

sections.summary: Volunteer examiner program: definitions; qualifications; preparation and administration of exams; accreditation; question pools; documentation requirements

questions.text: What is the minimum number of qualified VEs required to administer an Element 4 amateur operator license examination?
Where are the questions for all written US amateur license examinations listed?

answers.D: In the appropriate FCC Report and Order
answers.B: In a question pool maintained by the FCC
answers.C: In a question pool maintained by all the VECs

questions.text: What is a Volunteer Examiner Coordinator?

answers.D: The person who has entered into an agreement with the FCC to be the VE session manager
answers.B: A person who has volunteered to prepare amateur operator license examinations
answers.C: An organization that has entered into an agreement with the FCC to coordinate amateur operator license examinations
answers.A: A person who has volunteered to administer amateur operator license examinations

questions.text: Which of the following best describes the Volunteer Examiner accreditation process?

answers.D: The procedure by which a VEC confirms that the VE applicant meets FCC requirements to serve as an examiner
answers.B: The amateur operator applying must pass a VE examination administered by the FCC Enforcement Bureau
answers.C: The prospective VE obtains accreditation from the FCC
answers.A: Each General, Advanced and Amateur Extra Class operator is automatically accredited as a VE when the license is granted

answers.D: Minimum passing score of 77%
answers.C: Minimum passing score of 80%

questions.text: What is the minimum passing score on amateur operator license examinations?
Who is responsible for the proper conduct and necessary supervision during an amateur operator license examination session?

answers.D: The VE session manager
answers.C: Each administering VE

questions.text: What should a VE do if a candidate fails to comply with the examiner's instructions during an amateur operator license examination?

answers.D: Immediately terminate everyones examination and close the session
answers.C: Allow the candidate to complete the examination, but invalidate the results
answers.A: Warn the candidate that continued failure to comply will result in termination of the examination

questions.text: To which of the following examinees may a VE not administer an examination?

answers.D: All of these choices are correct
answers.C: Relatives of the VE as listed in the FCC rules

questions.text: What may be the penalty for a VE who fraudulently administers or certifies an examination?

answers.D: All of these choices are correct
answers.B: A fine of up to $1000 per occurrence
answers.C: A sentence of up to one year in prison
answers.A: Revocation of the VE's amateur station license grant and the suspension of the VE's amateur operator license grant

answers.D: They must collect and send the documents to the FCC according to instructions
answers.B: They must collect and submit the documents to the coordinating VEC for grading
answers.C: They must submit the application document to the coordinating VEC according to the coordinating VEC instructions
answers.A: They must collect and send the documents to the NCVEC for grading

questions.text: What must the administering VEs do after the administration of a successful examination for an amateur operator license?
What must the VE team do if an examinee scores a passing grade on all examination elements needed for an upgrade or new license?

answers.D: All these choices are correct
answers.B: Three VEs must certify that the examinee is qualified for the license grant and that they have complied with the administering VE requirements
answers.C: Issue the examinee the new or upgrade license
answers.A: Photocopy all examination documents and forward them to the FCC for processing

questions.text: What must the VE team do with the application form if the examinee does not pass the exam?

answers.D: Destroy the application form
answers.B: Maintain the application form with the VEC's records
answers.C: Send the application form to the FCC and inform the FCC of the grade
answers.A: Return the application document to the examinee

questions.text: What are the consequences of failing to appear for re-administration of an examination when so directed by the FCC?

answers.D: All these choices are correct
answers.B: The person may be fined or imprisoned
answers.C: The licensee is disqualified from any future examination for an amateur operator license grant
answers.A: The licensee's license will be cancelled

questions.text: For which types of out-of-pocket expenses do the Part 97 rules state that VEs and VECs may be reimbursed?

answers.D: Providing amateur operator license examination preparation training materials
answers.B: Teaching an amateur operator license examination preparation course
answers.C: No expenses are authorized for reimbursement
answers.A: Preparing, processing, administering and coordinating an examination for an amateur radio license

sections.summary: Miscellaneous rules: external RF power amplifiers; national quiet zone; business communications; compensated communications; spread spectrum; auxiliary stations; reciprocal operating privileges; IARP and CEPT licenses; third party communications with foreign countries; special temporary authority

questions.text: On what frequencies are spread spectrum transmissions permitted?

answers.D: Only on amateur frequencies above 144 MHz
answers.B: Only on amateur frequencies above 222 MHz
answers.C: Only on amateur frequencies above 420 MHz
answers.A: Only on amateur frequencies above 50 MHz

questions.text: Which of the following operating arrangements allows an FCC-licensed US citizen to operate in many European countries, and alien amateurs from many European countries to operate in the US?

answers.D: All of these choices are correct
answers.C: ITU reciprocal license

questions.text: Under what circumstances may a dealer sell an external RF power amplifier capable of operation below 144 MHz if it has not been granted FCC certification?

answers.D: It was imported from a manufacturer in another country, and it was certificated by that country's government
answers.B: The equipment dealer assembled it from a kit
answers.C: It was imported from a manufacturer in a country that does not require certification of RF power amplifiers
answers.A: It was purchased in used condition from an amateur operator and is sold to another amateur operator for use at that operator's station

questions.text: Which of the following geographic descriptions approximately describes "Line A"?

answers.D: A line roughly parallel to and east of the US Pacific coastline
answers.B: A line roughly parallel to and west of the US Atlantic coastline
answers.C: A line roughly parallel to and north of the US-Mexican border and Gulf coastline
answers.A: A line roughly parallel to and south of the US-Canadian border

questions.text: Amateur stations may not transmit in which of the following frequency segments if they are located in the contiguous 48 states and north of Line A?
What is the National Radio Quiet Zone?

answers.D: An area in Florida surrounding Cape Canaveral
answers.B: An area in New Mexico surrounding the White Sands Test Area
answers.C: An area surrounding the National Radio Astronomy Observatory
answers.A: An area in Puerto Rico surrounding the Aricebo Radio Telescope

questions.text: When may an amateur station send a message to a business?

answers.D: When neither the amateur nor his or her employer has a pecuniary interest in the communications
answers.B: When the control operator is employed by the FCC or another government agency
answers.C: When transmitting international third-party communications
answers.A: When the total money involved does not exceed $25

questions.text: Which of the following types of amateur station communications are prohibited?

answers.D: Communications in a language other than English
answers.B: Communications that have a political content, except as allowed by the Fairness Doctrine
answers.C: Communications that have a religious content
answers.A: Communications transmitted for hire or material compensation, except as otherwise provided in the rules

answers.D: All of these choices are correct
answers.B: The transmitting station must be in an area regulated by the FCC or in a country that permits SS emissions
answers.C: The transmission must not be used to obscure the meaning of any communication
answers.A: A station transmitting SS emission must not cause harmful interference to other stations employing other authorized emissions

questions.text: Which of the following conditions apply when transmitting spread spectrum emission?
What is the maximum transmitter power for an amateur station transmitting spread spectrum communications?

answers.D: 1.5 kW

questions.text: Which of the following best describes one of the standards that must be met by an external RF power amplifier if it is to qualify for a grant of FCC certification?

answers.D: It must satisfy the FCC's spurious emission standards when operated at the lesser of 1500 watts, or its full output power
answers.B: It must be capable of external RF switching between its input and output networks
answers.C: It must exhibit a gain of 0 dB or less over its full output range
answers.A: It must produce full legal output when driven by not more than 5 watts of mean RF input power

questions.text: Who may be the control operator of an auxiliary station?

answers.D: Only Amateur Extra Class operators
answers.B: Only Technician, General, Advanced or Amateur Extra Class operators
answers.C: Only General, Advanced or Amateur Extra Class operators

questions.text: What types of communications may be transmitted to amateur stations in foreign countries?

answers.D: All of these choices are correct
answers.B: Messages intended for connection to users of the maritime satellite service
answers.C: Communications incidental to the purpose of the amateur service and remarks of a personal nature

questions.text: Under what circumstances might the FCC issue a "Special Temporary Authority" (STA) to an amateur station?

answers.D: To provide temporary operation while awaiting normal licensing
answers.B: To allow regular operation on Land Mobile channels
answers.C: To provide additional spectrum for personal use
answers.A: To provide for experimental amateur communications

sections.summary: Amateur radio in space: amateur satellites; orbital mechanics; frequencies and modes; satellite hardware; satellite operations

questions.text: What is the direction of an ascending pass for an amateur satellite?

answers.D: From north to south
answers.C: From south to north

questions.text: What is the direction of a descending pass for an amateur satellite?

answers.D: From south to north
answers.C: From east to west

questions.text: What is the orbital period of an Earth satellite?

answers.D: The time it takes for a satellite to travel from perigee to apogee
answers.B: The point of minimum height of a satellite's orbit
answers.C: The time it takes for a satellite to complete one revolution around the Earth
answers.A: The point of maximum height of a satellite's orbit

questions.text: What is meant by the term mode as applied to an amateur radio satellite?

answers.D: Whether the satellite is in a polar or equatorial orbit
answers.B: The satellite's uplink and downlink frequency bands
answers.C: The satellite's orientation with respect to the Earth
answers.A: The type of signals that can be relayed through the satellite

questions.text: What do the letters in a satellite's mode designator specify?

answers.D: The uplink and downlink frequency ranges
answers.B: The location of the ground control station
answers.C: The polarization of uplink and downlink signals
answers.A: Power limits for uplink and downlink transmissions

questions.text: On what band would a satellite receive signals if it were operating in mode U/V?
Which of the following types of signals can be relayed through a linear transponder?

answers.D: All of these choices are correct
answers.C: PSK and Packet

answers.D: To avoid interfering with terrestrial QSOs
answers.B: To avoid reducing the downlink power to all other users
answers.C: To prevent the satellite from emitting out of band signals
answers.A: To prevent creating errors in the satellite telemetry

questions.text: Why should effective radiated power to a satellite which uses a linear transponder be limited?
What do the terms L band and S band specify with regard to satellite communications?

answers.D: Which sideband to use
answers.C: FM and Digital Store-and-Forward systems

questions.text: Why may the received signal from an amateur satellite exhibit a rapidly repeating fading effect?

answers.D: Because of the Doppler Effect
answers.C: Because of the satellite's low orbital altitude

questions.text: What type of antenna can be used to minimize the effects of spin modulation and Faraday rotation?

sections.summary: The Smith chart

questions.text: Which of the following can be calculated using a Smith chart?

answers.D: Radio propagation
answers.C: Antenna radiation pattern

questions.text: What type of coordinate system is used in a Smith chart?

answers.D: Resistance lines and reactance chords
answers.C: Voltage lines and current chords

questions.text: Which of the following is often determined using a Smith chart?

answers.D: Trigonometric functions
answers.C: Impedance and SWR values in transmission lines

questions.text: What are the two families of circles and arcs that make up a Smith chart?

answers.D: Voltage and impedance
answers.C: Resistance and reactance

questions.text: What type of chart is shown in Figure E9-3?

answers.D: Azimuth angle radiation pattern chart
answers.C: Elevation angle radiation pattern chart

questions.text: On the Smith chart shown in Figure E9-3, what is the name for the large outer circle on which the reactance arcs terminate?

answers.D: Polar axis
answers.C: Impedance axis

questions.text: On the Smith chart shown in Figure E9-3, what is the only straight line shown?

answers.D: The resistance axis
answers.C: The voltage axis

questions.text: What is the process of normalization with regard to a Smith chart?

answers.D: Reassigning prime center with regard to the reactance axis
answers.B: Reassigning reactance values with regard to the resistance axis
answers.C: Reassigning impedance values with regard to the prime center
answers.A: Reassigning resistance values with regard to the reactance axis

questions.text: What third family of circles is often added to a Smith chart during the process of solving problems?

answers.D: Radiation-pattern circles
answers.C: Coaxial-length circles

questions.text: What do the arcs on a Smith chart represent?

answers.D: Points with constant reactance
answers.C: Points with constant resistance

questions.text: How are the wavelength scales on a Smith chart calibrated?

answers.D: In fractions of antenna electrical frequency
answers.B: In fractions of transmission line electrical wavelength
answers.C: In fractions of antenna electrical wavelength
answers.A: In fractions of transmission line electrical frequency

questions.text: What, if any, are the differences between the radiation produced by radioactive materials and the electromagnetic energy radiated by an antenna?
